abstract: The court found that Dell shares were worth about $17.62 at the time of the 2013 buyout, not the $13.75 that Michael S. Dell and Silver Lake paid.
snippet: The court found that Dell shares were worth about $17.62 at the time of the 2013 buyout, not the $13.75 that Michael S. Dell and Silver Lake paid.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Three years after Michael S. Dell and the investment firm Silver Lake took Dell Inc. private, a Delaware judge has decided that the $24 billion deal was 21 percent too cheap.

headline.main: Dell Buyout Deal Shortchanged Shareholders, Court Rules
headline.print_headline: Dell Buyout Deal Shortchanged Shareholders, Court Rules

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
